question_text: How do you identify if a system problem is a hardware problem versus a software problem?
answer_options: Hardware problems only occur during business hours, software problems occur anytime
Hardware problems are consistent across different OS, occur during POST/boot, have physical symptoms
Software problems always require complete system reinstallation to resolve
Hardware problems can only be diagnosed by manufacturer technicians
correct_answer: Hardware problems are consistent across different OS, occur during POST/boot, have physical symptoms
explanation: Hardware problem indicators: consistent failures across different OS, occurs during POST/boot, physical symptoms (overheating, noises), fails hardware diagnostics. Software problem indicators: works in safe mode, occurs after software changes, random crashes during specific applications, resolves with driver updates. Test with minimal configuration and bootable diagnostics to isolate.
